789.text: A new series of PBDTT - DPP - TPD random terpolymers containing two different electron - deficient units ( DPP and TPD ) were synthesized to produce polymers with complementary and broad light absorption from 400 to 900 nm .

790.text: Through the variation of DPP to TPD composition in the polymers , we successfully tuned the frontier energy levels and illustrated the benefits of this approach in relation to PSC device performance .

791.text: The optimal ratio of 75 : 25 between DPP and TPD in the random terpolymers enhanced the efficiency of P3 : PC71BM , exhibiting 6.33 % due to improved light absorption and thus a J SC value higher than 16 mA / cm^2 .
pred: thus a J SC value higher than 16 mA / cm^2
the efficiency of P3 : PC71BM , exhibiting 6.33 %

792.text: In contrast , P5 and P6 with higher TPD contents of 75 and 90 % , respectively , exhibited PCE values of 2 - 3 % , which are significantly lower than those observed for P1 and P7 .

793.text: Consequently , these findings suggest that the design and synthesis of new random terpolymers is a promising way to broaden the absorption of their parent polymers and that optimization of the composition of random terpolymers is critically important to maximize the PSC performance .
pred: the absorption of their parent polymers

794.text: Two donor - acceptor ( D - A ) copolymers , PzNDTDTBT and PzNDTDTBO , using 4,naphtho [ 1,2 - b:5,6 - b′]dithiophene as an electron - rich unit and benzodiathiazole ( BT ) or benzoxadiazole(BO ) as an electron - deficient one , were designed and synthesized via a Pd - catalyzed Stillecoupling method .

795.text: The acceptor units were varied from BT to BO for adjusting the energy levels and optimizing the structures of polymers .

796.text: Both copolymers possess good solubility , high thermal stability , broad absorption , and low bandgap and exhibit not only high field - effect mobilities but also high photovoltaic properties .

799.text: Both the hole mobilities and PCEs are among the highest values in the current reports based on naphthodithiophene - based polymers , indicating that " zigzag " naphthodithiophene - based D - A copolymers are very promising for application as solution - processable organic semiconductors in optoelectronic devices .

800.text: 1 - 3 Current state - of - the - art polymeric materials have allowed for the fabrication of OFETs with mobilities of over 1 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 and OPV devices with power conversion efficiencies ( PCEs ) of over 9 % .
pred: power conversion efficiencies ( PCEs ) of over 9 %
mobilities of over 1 cm^2 V -1 s^-1

801.text: 4,5 Although remarkable progress has been made in the design and synthesis of p - type polymer semiconductors , their performances in terms of hole mobilities and photovoltaic properties remain to be further optimized and maximized .

802.text: By judicious selection of the donor and the acceptor units , the D - A copolymer architecture enables engineering of the electronic structure including energy levels of the highest occupied molecular orbital ( HOMO ) and the lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) , the energy band gap , and light harvesting properties as well as charge transport properties .

803.text: 7 Among the currently available classes of materials , thiophenefused polycyclic heteroaromatics have aroused great interest due to their high charge transport properties .

804.text: In particular , the acenedithiophene family , in which two thiophenes are fused at the ends of acenes , such as benzodithiophenes ( BDTs ) , 8 naphthodithiophenes ( NDTs ) , 9 and anthradithiophenes ( ADTs ) , 10 offers multiple advantages over other classes owing to their ease of functionalization at the α - positions of thiophene substructures for easy and precise cross - coupling polymerization .
pred: easy and precise cross - coupling polymerization
ease of functionalization at the α - positions of thiophene substructures

805.text: Also , integration of thiophene with acene rings into a rigid and coplanar entity facilitates π - electron delocalization and induces strong π - π stacking for efficient charge transport .

806.text: For example , Takimiya and co - workers reported four different NDTn isomers as shown in Figure 1 , which allowed to create a broad variety of NDTn - based polymer semiconductor materials , and high OFET performance with mobility of up to 0.77 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 based on PNDT3BT was achieved .
pred: mobility of up to 0.77 cm^2 V -1 s^-1
a broad variety of NDTn - based polymer semiconductor materials

807.text: 11 However , despite these numerous attractive properties of NDT - based polymer semiconductors , their limited solubility in organic solvents has hindered their widespread applications in organic electronics and optoelectronics .

808.text: 12 To achieve the solubility and thin film uniformity required in solution processed OPVs and OFETs , NDT1 and NDT3 functionalized with two alkoxy groups were synthesized and applied in semiconductor materials recently ( Figure 1 ) .

809.text: 13 In addition , it was found that , compared with linear - fused NDT units , the copolymer incorporating the angular - fused NDT units can pack into higher ordered structures , thereby achieving higher OFET mobilities .

810.text: It was also reported that angular - fused NDT has a lower - lying HOMO energy level than that of linearfused NDT , which could be beneficial for better air stability and greater open - circuit voltage ( V oc ) for polymer solar cells ( PSCs ) .
pred: greater open - circuit voltage ( V oc )

811.text: 9c Very recently , our group reported a broad bandgap D - A copolymer PzNDTTPD based on 4,9 - bis(2 - ethylhexyloxy)-naphtho [ 1,2 - b:5,6 - b′]dithiophene and thieno [ 3,4 - c]pyrrole-4,6dione ( TPD ) .

812.text: 14 The polymer solar cells ( PSCs ) with PzNDTTPD as donor and [ 6,6]-phenyl - C71 - butyric acid methyl ester ( PC71BM ) as acceptor demonstrated a PCE of 5.26 % with a high V oc of 0.91 V compared to the linear NDT - TPD - based copolymer PNDTTPD with a PCE of 4.0 % and a V oc of 0.69 V. 15 Meanwhile , high - performance p - channel fieldeffect transistors with hole mobility of 0.067 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 and an on / off current ratio of 10 ^ 9 -10 ^ 10 were obtained .
pred: hole mobility of 0.067 cm^2 V -1 s^-1

813.text: It is indicative that " zigzag " NDT ( zNDT)-based D - A polymers probably possess unique and excellent optoelectronic properties when combined with a suitable acceptor moiety .

814.text: On the other hand , we noted that benzodiathiazole ( BT)-or benzoxadiazole ( BO)based conjugated polymers are one of the most important organic semiconductors due to their easy preparation , excellent stability , and optoelectronic characteristics , and many efforts have been devoted to the design and synthesis of new BT / BO derivatives .

816.text: 18,19 However , to the best of our knowledge , BT / BO - based polymers simultaneously with high field - effect mobilities and high photovoltaic performance are very rare so far .

818.text: On the basis of the above consideration , herein , we designed and synthesized two new D - A copolymers PzNDTDTBT and PzNDTDTBO ( Scheme 1 ) based on zNDT flanked with two thiophene units as donor unit and BT or BO as acceptor unit .

819.text: We introduced two dodecyloxy substituents on BT / BO rings to guarantee good solubility of the polymers .

820.text: The results showed that both the two polymers exhibit not only high fieldeffect mobilities but also high photovoltaic properties .

821.text: The molecular weights of the polymers were determined by GPC in THF solution relative to polystyrene standards , and the detailed GPC data are listed in Table 1 ..

822.text: Both polymers have good thermal stability with onset decomposition temperatures with 5 % weight loss at 313 - 320 ° C .
pred: onset decomposition temperatures with 5 % weight loss at 313 - 320 °

824.text: , including the absorption peak wavelengths ( λ abs ) , the absorption edge wavelengths ( λ onset ) , and the optical band gap ( E g opt ) .
pred: optical band gap ( E g opt )

825.text: In Figure 3a , both of the absorption spectra recorded from dilute chloroform solutions display π - π * transitions at around 425 nm and large charge transfer features between 500 and 700 nm which are assigned by analogy to similar polymers , corresponding to intramolecular charge transfer ( ICT ) between the acceptor ( BT / BO ) and donor ( NDT ) units .
pred: large charge transfer features between 500 and 700 nm
π - π * transitions at around 425 nm

827.text: The stronger ICT within PzNDTDTBO is originated from a relatively stronger electron - withdrawing nature of BO unit compared to that of the BT one .

828.text: In films , the absorption spectra of PzNDTDTBT and PzNDTDTBO are similar to those in solution , with obvious red - shifts ( 56 - 68 nm ) of their absorption maxima as shown in Figure 3b , which is a common phenomenon for conjugated polymers , owing to the aggregation of the conjugated polymer main chains in the solid films .
pred: the absorption spectra of PzNDTDTBT and PzNDTDTBO

829.text: In addition , both PzNDTDTBT and PzNDTDTBO display prominent vibronic shoulders at shorter wavelengths , implying an ordered arrangement in their solid films , with strong π - π stacking between the polymeric backbonesa feature that also appears in the spectra of regioregular poly(3 - hexylthiophene ) ( P3HT ) , which is beneficial to improve the charge mobility of resulting films .

831.text: Compared with the reported copolymer PzNDTTPD , 14 both PzNDTDTBT and PzNDTDTBO show broader absorption spectra and smaller bandgaps , which can be attributed to the stronger electron - accepting ability of the BT / BO unit in the copolymer , and this is beneficial to increase the light - harvesting capacity for higher short - circuit current density ( J sc ) .
pred: higher short - circuit current density ( J sc )
the stronger electron - accepting ability of the BT / BO unit

832.text: 22 From the onset oxidation and reduction potentials in the cyclic voltammogram , energy levels of HOMO and LUMO can be readily estimated , which correspond to ionization potential ( IP ) and electron affinity ( EA ) , respectively .

833.text: The onset oxidation potential ( E ox ) / onset reduction potential ( E red ) of PzNDTDTBT and PzNDTDTBO are 0.75 / -0.97 and 0.90 / -1.02 V vs Ag / AgCl , respectively .

834.text: The HOMO and LUMO energy levels of the polymer were The HOMO , LUMO , and electrochemical bandgaps ( E g ec ) of PzNDTDTBT and PzNDTDTBO , calculated from the value of E ox and E red of the polymers , are -5.15 / -3.43 / 1.71 and -5.30 / -3.38 / 1.92 eV , respectively ( see Table 2 ) .

835.text: For the convenience of comparison , the optical and electrochemical parameters of the PzNDTTPD are also given in Table 2 .

836.text: The electrochemical band gaps of the polymers match well with their optical band gaps within the experimental error .

837.text: It can be noticed that the HOMO energy level of PzNDTDTBO is 0.15 eV lower than that of PzNDTDTBT , which benefits from the replacement of BT unit by the stronger electron - accepting BO unit due to the stronger electronegativity of oxygen atom than that of sulfur atom .

838.text: Since the open - circuit voltage V oc of bulk heterojunction ( BHJ ) PSCs is positively correlated to the difference between the LUMO energy level of the acceptor and the HOMO energy level of the donor polymer , a higher V oc for PzNDTDTBObased polymer solar cells could be anticipated due to the lowerlying HOMO energy level of PzNDTDTBO .
pred: the difference between the LUMO energy level of the acceptor and the HOMO energy level of the donor polymer
the lowerlying HOMO energy level of PzNDTDTBO

839.text: To investigate the photovoltaic properties of the NDT - based semiconductor , PSC devices with a configuration of ITO / PEDOT : PSS / polymer : PC71BM / Ca / Al were fabricated .

840.text: Figure 5 shows the current density - voltage characteristic of PSCs based on the blends of polymer : PC71BM under illumination of AM1.5 G , 100 mW cm^-2 .

841.text: To further study the performance of the PSC devices , the hole mobilities in the photosensitive layers were measured by the space charge limited current ( SCLC ) method using devices with structure of ITO / PEDOT : PSS / polymer : PC71BM / Au at the optimized blend ratio of polymer / PC71BM .
pred: optimized blend ratio of polymer / PC71BM

842.text: For unipolar transport in a trap - free semiconductor with an ohmic injecting contact , the SCLC can be approximated by the Mott - Gurney equation : ε ε μ γ ≅ ⎛ ⎝ ⎜ ⎞ ⎠ ⎟ J V L V L 9 ^ 8 exp 0.891 r 0 ^ 0 2 ^ 3 ( 3 ) Here J is the current density , ε r is the dielectric constant of the polymer , ε 0 is the free - space permittivity ( 8.85 × 10 ^ -12 F / m ) , μ 0 is the charge mobility at zero field , γ is a constant , L is the thickness of the blended film layer , V = V appl - V bi , V appl is the applied potential , and V bi is the built - in potential which results from the difference in the work function of the anode and the cathode ( in this device structure , V bi = 0.2 V ) .
pred: dielectric constant of the polymer , ε
thickness of the blended film layer

843.text: Figure 6 displays the ln(JL 3 / V 2 ) vs ( V / L ) 0.5 curve for the measurement of the hole mobility of the blend films of PzNDTDTBT / PC71BM ( 1 : 2 , w / w ) and PzNDTDTBO / PC71BM ( 1.5 : 1 , w / w ) by the SCLC method .
pred: blend films of PzNDTDTBT / PC71BM ( 1 : 2 , w / w )

845.text: Obviously , from the viewpoint of hole mobility , PzNDTDTBO is more suitable ( higher than 10 ^ -2 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 ) for the application as photovoltaic donor materials in PSCs .

846.text: The V oc , J sc , fill factor ( FF ) , PCE , and hole mobility of the PSCs are summarized in Table 3 .

847.text: The blends of PzNDTDTBT or PzNDTDTBO with PC71BM at different weight ratios were used to optimize the device performances , and their J - V curves are shown in Figure 5 .

848.text: The PSCs based on PzNDTDTBO / PC71BM demonstrated better photovoltaic performance than that based on PzNDTDTBT / PC71BM .

849.text: With a weight ratio of PzNDTDTBO to PC71BM 1.5 : 1 , a PCE of 4.37 % with V oc of 0.76 V , J sc of 10.35 mA cm^-2 , and FF of 55.5 % was achieved while the devices based on PzNDTDTBT showed a relatively low PCE of 2.43 % , with V oc of 0.62 V , J sc of 8.21 mA cm^-2 , and FF of 47.7 % at the optimal PzNDTDTBT / PC71BM ratio of 1 : 2 ( w / w ) .

850.text: The increased value of V oc of PzNDTDTBO - based PSCs is in accordance with the decreased value of the HOMO energy level of the polymer and the higher J sc and FF could be attributed to the higher hole mobility ( 4.4 × 10 ^ -2 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 ) .
pred: the higher hole mobility ( 4.4 × 10 ^ -2 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 )
The increased value of V oc of PzNDTDTBO - based PSCs
the decreased value of the HOMO energy level of the polymer

851.text: By addition of 1 % 1,8 - diiodooctane ( DIO ) into o - DCB used for spin - coating , the PCEs of the solar cells based on PzNDTDTBT or PzNDTDTBO were improved to 3.22 and 4.63 % , respectively , mostly through an increase in the FF .

852.text: , the FF of PzNDTDTBO - based PSCs increased from 62.5 to 65.5 % , and consequently , the PCE increased from 4.63 to 5.07 % .

853.text: However , for PzNDTDTBT , the measured PCE was not improved by thermal annealing but , inversely , exhibited a slight decrease of photovoltaic values .

854.text: Compared with PzNDTDTBT / PzNDTDTBO , PSCs based on PzNDTTPD shows higher V oc , which corresponds to the deepest HOMO energy level of PzNDTTPD ( see Table 2 ) .
pred: the deepest HOMO energy level of PzNDTTPD

856.text: Without additive or thermal annealing , both the blend films based on PzNDTDTBT and PzNDTDTBO demonstrate smooth morphology with low average surface roughness ( R a ) of 0.27 and 1.23 nm , respectively .

857.text: After adding DIO , a nanoscaled fine interpenetrating network and smaller domain size of phase separation are formed , which is beneficial to the exciton dissociation and charge carriers transport .
pred: smaller domain size of phase separation

859.text: When the PzNDTDTBO blend film was then thermally annealed at 150 ° C for 10 min , R a is further increased .

860.text: However , it seems that some larger phase aggregation occurs in PzNDTDTBT / PC71BM blend , which has a negative effect on the PSCs and corresponds to the slight photovoltaic performance degradation of PzNDTDTBT .

861.text: The devices showed a relatively high photoconversion efficiency over the whole wavelength range of 300 - 700 nm , with monochromatic EQE values around 50 - 60 % .

862.text: Compared to the absorption spectra of pristine polymers , the significantly broadened EQE responses in the visible region can be attributed to both the intrinsic absorptions of the polymers and PC71BM .

863.text: Also , it can be noted that devices based on PzNDTDTBO show stronger Field - Effect Transistor Properties .

864.text: The performances of polymer field - effect transistors based on PzNDTDTBT and PzNDTDTBO were investigated using a bottom - gate , bottomcontact configuration .

865.text: All devices with L = 5 μm showed the highest hole mobility at different annealing temperatures .

866.text: As shown in Table 4 , for both polymers the annealing temperature tends to affect the hole mobility .

867.text: After thermal annealing , the hole mobilities of both copolymers are increased , which implies that the crystallinity of the polymer films and ordered lamellar structure of π - π closepacking for polymer main chain are significantly improved at higher temperatures .

868.text: High current modulation is observed with on / off current ratio of 10 ^ 6 -10 ^ 7 for PzNDTBTBO while PzNDTDTBT shows relatively lower on / off ratio of 10 ^ 3 -10 ^ 4 .

870.text: Both the hole mobilities are among the highest values for BT - or BO - based polymers .

871.text: In order to deeply study the variation of the performances of OFETs of PzNDTDTBT and PzNDTDTBO after annealing , the thin - film microstructures and topographies were investigated by X - ray diffraction ( XRD ) and AFM .

872.text: Figure 11 shows XRD patterns of the polymer thin films deposited on OTSmodified Si / SiO 2 substrates .

873.text: For both polymers , obvious diffraction peaks were detected before the samples were annealed , which indicates that some degree of crystallinity has been formed at room temperature .

874.text: PzNDTDTBT showed a sharp diffraction peak at 2θ = 21.4 ° and two weak peaks at 23.8 ° and 26.6 ° for the as - prepared thin film .

877.text: These XRD studies clearly manifest the enhancement of molecular ordering within thin films of PzNDTDTBT and PzNDTDTBO after annealing , which are in agreement with the observation that hole mobilities of devices increase with annealing .

878.text: In addition , the high crystallinity of the PzNDTDTBO film can also explain the high hole mobility of the PzNDTDTBO / PC71BM blend film measured by SCLC method mentioned above .

879.text: AFM images were performed on polymer thin films on OTSmodified SiO 2 / Si substrates as shown in Figure 12 .

880.text: With film annealing treatments , the films form larger crystal grains and better film interconnectivity , which are favorable for the charge transport and lead to an increase of the mobility .

881.text: In conclusion , two new D - A copolymers with zNDT as donor unit and BT or BO as acceptor unit , namely PzNDTDTBT and PzNDTDTBO , have been synthesized by the Pd - catalyzed Stille - coupling reaction and well characterized .
pred: BT or BO as acceptor unit

882.text: Both the copolymers possess good solubility and thermal stability as well as low bandgap for efficient photon harvesting .

883.text: Compared with its BT - based analogue PzNDTDTBT , the introduction of the stronger electron - accepting BO unit into PzNDTDTBO not only enhanced the intramolecular charge transfer in the conjugated polymer but also downshifted the HOMO energy level of the organic semiconductor , and as a result , BHJ solar cells incorporating blends of the PzNDTDTBO with PC71BM showed the PCE of 5.07 % after device optimization such as adding additive and thermal annealing , while a PCE of 3.22 % was obtained in PzNDTDTBT - based devices .

884.text: OFETs devices based on PzNDTDTBT and PzNDTDTBO exhibit high carrier mobilities of 0.43 and 0.34 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 , respectively .

885.text: Both the hole mobilities and PCEs are among the highest values in the current reported devices fabricated from naphthodithiophenebased copolymers .

886.text: These results demonstrate that the 4,9bis(2 - ethylhexyloxy)naphtho [ 1,2 - b:5,6 - b′]dithiophene is a promising versatile core unit for developing high - performance OFETs and polymer solar cells .

887.text: Three donor - acceptor type of narrow band gap conjugated polymers with enlarged coplanar skeleton were synthesized via Stille copolymerization of indacenodithiophene ( IDT ) and naphtho [ 1,2 - c:5,6 - c]bis(1,2,5 - thiadiazole ) ( NT ) based monomers .

888.text: The energy levels , absorption spectra and band gaps of the resulting polymers were well tuned by utilizing different thiophene derivatives as spacer between IDT and NT units , and polymer PIDT - C12NT which employed bithiophene attached with dodecyl side chain as spacer exhibited superior properties compared to the other two copolymers .

889.text: All polymers exhibited deep highest occupied molecular orbital energy levels and subsequently lead to high open circuit voltages of fabricated solar cell devices .
pred: deep highest occupied molecular orbital energy levels

890.text: Best performance of the bulk - heterojunction solar cells with a power conversion efficiency of 5.05 % was achieved with PIDT - C12NT as donor and ( 6,6)-phenyl - C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PC71BM ) as acceptor , which can be attributed to its higher charge carrier mobility , the optimized interpenetrating network as well as enhanced absorption coefficient of photoactive layer with respect to the other two polymers .
pred: enhanced absorption coefficient of photoactive layer

892.text: 1 - 3 PSCs based on bulk - heterojunction ( BHJ ) architecture are of particular interests since high performance devices with power conversion efficiencies ( PCE ) exceed 8 % can be achieved .

893.text: 4 - 9 Typical BHJ devices comprise a phaseseparated donor / acceptor blend layer with low band gap conjugated polymers as the electron donor , and fullerene derivatives such as [ 6,6]-phenyl - C61 - butyric acid methyl ester ( PC61BM ) or [ 6,6]-phenyl - C71 - butyric acid methyl ester ( PC71BM ) as the electron acceptor .
pred: [ 6,6]-phenyl - C61 - butyric acid methyl ester ( PC61BM )
[ 6,6]-phenyl - C71 - butyric acid methyl ester ( PC71BM )

894.text: 10,11 Generally , when considering that open circuit voltage ( V oc ) is related to the difference between the highest occupied molecular orbital ( HOMO ) energy level of donor materials and the lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) energy level of acceptor , 12,13 deep HOMO levels for low band gap conjugated polymers are preferred in order to attain high V oc .
pred: the difference between the highest occupied molecular orbital ( HOMO ) energy level of donor materials and the lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) energy level of acceptor

895.text: However , lowering HOMO level would result in larger band gap , and thereby the absorption of resulted polymers would have less overlap with solar spectrum , which are unfavorable for high short circuit current ( J sc ) .
pred: high short circuit current ( J sc )

896.text: To obtain the ideal low band gap polymer with appropriate energy levels that can make a tradeoff between open circuit voltage ( V oc ) and band gap so as to maximize the PCE , an intriguing approach involves incorporat - ing electron rich moieties ( donor , D ) and electron deficient moieties ( acceptor , A ) and alternating them on the backbone , which are so - called D - A type low band gap conjugated polymers .
pred: tradeoff between open circuit voltage ( V oc ) and band gap

897.text: 14 - 16 Recently , it was realized that the weak - donor and strong - acceptor strategy is especially effective , as the weak donor moieties can maintain low HOMO levels while strong acceptor moieties may result in narrow band gap via intramolecular charge transfer ( ICT ) .

898.text: 20 - 24 We have previously demonstrated a novel naphtho-[1,2 - c:5,6 - c]bis(1,2,5 - thiadiazole ) ( NT ) moiety with enlarged planarity relative to conventionally used acceptor of 2,1,3benzothiadiazole ( BT ) , which can be used as a strong acceptor for D - A polymers .
pred: strong acceptor for D - A polymers

899.text: 18 It was found that the NT - based polymers exhibited distinctly improved photovoltaic performances relative to the BT counterparts , which can be attributed to the enhanced carrier mobility and reduced the band gaps .

900.text: 18 The advantage of D - A type conjugated polymers bears NT as acceptor was also verified by using quaterthiophene or naphtho[1,2 - b:5,6 - b′]dithiophene as the donor unit .

901.text: Such NTbased polymers exhibit 1 order of magnitude increased hole mobility in conjunction with obviously improved photovoltaic properties with respect to the corresponding BT version , which can be ascribed to the centrosymmetric structure of NT that can lead to straighter backbone and more favorable side - chain placement than the axisymmetric BT structure .
pred: 1 order of magnitude increased hole mobility

902.text: 25,26 The fact indicates that NT is a versatile acceptor for high performance D - A type of conjugated polymers .

903.text: Recently , indacenodithiophene ( IDT ) with two thiophene rings held in a rigid arrangement via a central phenyl ring has emerged as a promising donor moiety for D - A polymers due to its good solubility and highly planar structures ( Scheme 1 ) .

906.text: 29,34 - 37 The IDT - based polymers presented deep HOMO levels and hence lead to considerably high V oc of the resulted devices .

907.text: Additionally , IDT - based polymers have presented pretty high mobility and the appropriate optical properties , which can facilitate the charge transport together with enhance the absorption of sunlight and subsequently lead to high J sc .

908.text: 38 Therefore , both IDT and NT are promising building blocks for D - A type low band gap polymers and the combination of the outstanding properties of IDT and NT may develop a series of promising donor materials for high performance PSCs .
pred: the combination of the outstanding properties of IDT and NT

909.text: In this manuscript , we report the synthesis and characterization of three D - A type IDT - NT based low band gap conjugated polymers , poly[2,7-(4,4,9,9 - tetra(p - octylphenyl)-s- indaceno[1,2 - b:5,6 - b′]-dithiophene)-alt-3,7-(di(4-(2 - ethylhex- yl)-2 - thienyl)-naphtho[1,2 - c:5,6 - c]bis[1,2,5]thiadiazole ) ] ( PIDT - EHNT ) , poly[2,7-(4,4,9,9 - tetra(p - octylphenyl)-s- indaceno[1,2 - b:5,6 - b′]-dithiophene)-alt-3,7-(di(4 - hexyl-2thienyl)-naphtho[1,2 - c:5,6 - c]bis[1,2,5]thiadiazole ) ] ( PIDT - DTNT ) and poly[2,7-(4,4,9,9 - tetra(p - octylphenyl)-s - indaceno-[1,2 - b:5,6 - b′]-dithiophene)-alt-3,7-(di(3′-dodecyl-5-(2,2′-bithienyl))-naphtho[1,2 - c:5,6 - c]bis(1,2,5 - thiadiazole ) ) ] ( PIDT - C12NT ) ( Scheme 2 ) , by using IDT as a weak donor and NT as a strong acceptor .
pred: poly[2,7-(4,4,9,9 - tetra(p - octylphenyl)-s- indaceno[1,2 - b:5,6 - b′]-dithiophene)-alt-3,7-(di(4
poly[2,7-(4,4,9,9 - tetra(p - octylphenyl)-s- indaceno[1,2 - b:5,6 - b′]-dithiophene)-alt-3,7-(di(4-(2

910.text: Taking into account the fact that both IDT and NT are comparatively rigid coplanar structures along the polymer backbone , the IDT - NT based polymers may suffer solubility issue since the tetraoctylbenzene groups attached to the carbon bridges of IDT unit would not be enough to guarantee their solubility in common organic solvents .

911.text: Therefore , the spacers consist of thiophene or bithiophene functionalized with various alkyl side chains were introduced in between IDT and NT units to improve the solubility of the resulting polymers , which may also potentially lead to improved molecular weight that is favorable for the optimal morphology and charge carrier transport .

912.text: 39 - 41 We notice that the incorporated side chains may also increase the dihedral angle of their contiguous aromatic units , 42,43 which may somewhat inhibit polymer backbone planarity and thereby increase band gap and lower the charge carrier mobility .

913.text: 40,41 However , it should be tried several different alkyl side chains to achieve a delicate balance of the molecular weight , solubility as well as planarity of polymers as no comprehensive rule has yet emerged of the influences of specific side chains .

914.text: 44,45 It was realized that by switching the spacer between the IDT and NT units , the processability , backbone planarity , charge carrier mobility and film morphology can be optimized .

915.text: Further investigation of photovoltaic performances indicates all devices present high V oc because of the relatively deep HOMO energy levels of these polymers , and the highest PCE of 5.05 % was achieved based on PIDT - C12NT .

916.text: No phase transition was observed for all three polymers by DSC analysis up to 300 ° C. All polymers have decomposition temperature ( defined as the 5 % weight - loss temperature , T d ) over 450 ° C under nitrogen as determined by TGA analysis , indicating their excellent thermal stabilities .

917.text: The UV - vis absorption spectra of all polymers in both chlorobenzene solution ( 1 × 10 ^ -3 mg mL -1 ) and as thin films ( spin - casted from chlorobenzene solutions with concentration of 8 mg mL -1 ) are shown in Figure 2 .

918.text: All three polymers exhibit dual characteristic absorption bands , where the short wavelength absorbance originated from the π - π * transition of the IDT unit , while the long wavelength absorbance could be ascribed to the intramolecular charge transfer ( ICT ) between the IDT and the NT segments .

919.text: 27 In chlorobenzene ( CB ) solution , PIDT - EHNT showed an absorption maximum at 599 nm and a slightly weaker peak at 433 nm ; when changing the branched 2ethylhexyl to linear hexyl side chain , the resulted polymer PIDT - DTNT showed a slightly bathochromic shift of two corresponding peaks to 608 and 439 nm , respectively , which may due to the reduced steric hindrance of the linear side chain .

921.text: 49 - 51 However , it was interesting to notice that PIDT - C12NT , which has four thiophenes in each repeat unit , presented a simultaneous bathochromic shift of short wavelength absorption peak to 465 nm and hypsochromic shift of the long wavelength absorption peak to 593 nm along with increased relative intensity of the high and low - energy peaks .
pred: bathochromic shift of short wavelength absorption peak to 465 nm
hypsochromic shift of the long wavelength absorption peak to 593 nm
increased relative intensity of the high and low - energy peaks

922.text: Analogous event has also been realized in D - A type of oligomers and polymers based on 3,4bis(2 - ethylhexyloxy)thiophene or 2 - ethylhexyloxy - substituted 3,4 - propylenedioxythiophene as donor and BT as acceptor , which demonstrated that with the depleting composition of BT unit along the conjugated backbone , the dual absorbing bands were induced to move toward the maximum absorption ( λ max ) of the all - donor homopolymer that located in between of the dual absorbance .

923.text: 52 In solid state , all polymers showed red - shifted absorption spectra compare to their solution absorption ( Figure 2b ) , which could be ascribed to the aggregation of polymer main chain .

962.text: A low band - gap copolymer consisting of 9,10 - thienyl - substituted anthracene ( TA ) as an electron - donating unit and diketopyrrolopyrrole ( DPP ) as an electron - withdrawing unit has been synthesized and applied to the donor material in polymer solar cells .

965.text: Moreover , the polymer solar cell as fabricated from the blend of the copolymer and di - perylene bisimide ( di - PBI ) as a non - fullerene electron acceptor exhibits a promising power conversion efficiency of 4.23 % with V OC = 0.77 V , J SC = 9.8 mA cm^-2 , and FF = 0.56 .

966.text: This photovoltaic performance of the copolymer not only demonstrates that the TA is a promising electron - donating building block for a high performance low band - gap copolymer , but also the copolymer is compatible with both PC71BM and a non - fullerene acceptor for high efficiency polymer solar cells .

967.text: [ 2][3][4][5 ] It has also been demonstrated that low band - gap conjugated polymers with broad absorption of the solar spectrum are promising active layer materials to achieve a high power conversion efficiency ( PCE ) .

969.text: [ 8][9][10][11 ] In recent efforts to develop high performance conjugated polymers , building blocks have been carefully designed for the conjugated polymers to have adequate energy levels , broad light absorption and strong self - assembly for use in BHJ PSC .

970.text: [ 12][13][14][15][16][17][18 ] As one of the most promising building blocks for constructing low band - gap conjugated polymers , diketopyrrolopyrrole ( DPP ) has emerged as the desirable electron - withdrawing moiety .

971.text: 19,20 Over the past five years , a variety of conjugated polymers containing DPP have been investigated as promising semiconductors for application in organic optoelectronics such as field effect transistors , memory devices and PSCs .

974.text: The incorporation of an extended fused aromatic unit in the polymer backbone is expected to induce strong intermolecular interactions ( π - π stacking ) , affording high crystallinity to the polymer and thus resulting in a reduced energy barrier for charge carrier transport .
pred: reduced energy barrier for charge carrier transport

975.text: Therefore , the DPP - based copolymers combined with fused heteroarenes have shown low band - gaps with excellent charge transport characteristics and thus a high short circuit current density ( J SC ) of the solar cell device .
pred: a high short circuit current density ( J SC )

976.text: [ 26][27][28][29 ] However , since low band - gap DPP - based copolymers usually exhibit a relatively high - lying highest occupied molecular orbital ( HOMO ) energy level , leading to a low open circuit voltage ( V OC ) of PSCs , a compromise between the band - gap and the HOMO energy level of DPP - based polymers is critically required .
pred: a low open circuit voltage ( V OC )
a compromise between the band - gap and the HOMO energy level

977.text: One way to solve the trade - off between V OC and J SC of the PSC based on low band - gap polymers is to introduce arene groups which have weak electron - donating power .

978.text: When a benzene or naphthalene group which has a weak electrondonating nature was incorporated into DPP - based copolymers , a low - lying HOMO energy level was achieved without a large sacrifice of the band - gap , and as a result PCEs were improved with enhanced V OC s as compared to the counterpart polymer with a strong electron - donating unit .
pred: a low - lying HOMO energy level

979.text: 30,31 Anthracene is also an interesting building block as an electron - donating unit for low band - gap conjugated polymers , because the electron - donating power of anthracene is relatively weaker than fused heteroarenes such as thieno [ 3,2 - b]thiophene and dithieno[3,2 - b:2′,3′-d]thiophene , and therefore , anthracene - based copolymers are expected to have a low - lying HOMO energy level .

980.text: Furthermore , anthracene - based copolymers usually exhibit high crystallinity and high charge carrier mobility due to the coplanar fused structure of the anthracene unit .

981.text: Therefore , a combination of DPP and anthracene could be ideal , thus leading to high J SC and V OC .

982.text: Nevertheless , a few studies have reported that anthracene - DPP conjugated polymers show low PCEs less than 3 % .

983.text: 32 Here , we synthesized low band - gap copolymers incorporating 9,10 - bis ( 5-(2 - ethylhexyl)thiophen-2 - yl)anthracene ( TA ) and DPP as an electron - donating and electron - withdrawing unit , respectively .

984.text: Very recently , we have successfully demonstrated that TA is a promising electron - donating moiety of medium band - gap conjugated copolymers for high performance polymer solar cells .

985.text: 33 In conjunction with its weak electrondonating characteristics , TA possesses an extended conjugation in 2 - D , which is expected to enhance the light absorption and self - assembly of the resulting copolymer .

986.text: 34 Some copolymers based on 9,10 - arene functionalized anthracene have recently been reported , but the absorption ranges of the polymers are limited to the wavelengths shorter than 700 nm and their PCEs are moderate , 4 - 5 % .

1047.text: A novel conjugated polymer of PBDT - TDPP - S was synthesized , which contains a donor unit of benzo [ 1,2b:4,5 - b′]dithiophene in main chain and an acceptor unit of diketopyrrolopyrrole in side chain .

1056.text: , pyrrolo[3,4 - c]pyrrole-1,4(2H,5H)-dione unit has a well conjugated structure with strong π - π interaction and electron - withdrawing effect , some main - chain D - A copolymers based on DPP or / and BDT units as prime building block had been designed for optoelectronic applications in both thin - film transistors and solar cells in recent years .

1095.text: Moreover , the observed hole mobility is higher than those of the recent reported mainchain D - A polymers , 9 verifying that side - chain D - A polymers can have strong intermolecular orbital overlap and good molecular packing like main - chain D - A polymers .

1096.text: Besides the high hole mobility , the blend also presented high electron mobility in range of 4.4 × 10 ^ -4 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 ( see Figure S7 ) .

1097.text: The measured hole and electron mobility are listed in Table 4 .

1098.text: Such high and balanced hole - electron mobility for the PBDT - TDPP - S is responsible for the high FF level in the devices .

1099.text: To our best knowledge , the FF is the highest reported to date for side - chain D - A conjugated copolymers The surface morphology of the active layers was studied using atomic force microscopy ( AFM ) under tapping mode in order to further understand why the device exhibited better photovoltaic properties at the annealing temperature of 120 ° C. Figure S8 shows typical AFM topography of the PBDT - TDPP - S : PC71BM blend film in unannealed and annealed conditions ( see Supporting Information ) .

1100.text: In summary , a novel conjugated polymer of PBDT - TDPP - S was successfully obtained , which contains a donor unit of benzo [ 1,2 - b:4,5 - b′]dithiophene in main chain and an acceptor unit of diketopyrrolopyrrole in side chain .

1101.text: The resultant sidechain D - A polymer exhibited high carrier mobility and outstanding photovoltaic properties in polymer solar cells with a PCE as high as 4.89 % .

1102.text: The PCE level is the highest reported to date in the side - chain D - A conjugated copolymersbased single BHJ PSCs , which is twice higher than that of the corresponding main - chain D - A polymer - based ones .

1103.text: A highly effective photovoltaic polymer with near - infrared response , poly{N- [ 3,4 - c]pyrrole-1,4 - dione-5 0 , 5 00 -diyl } { PDTP - DTDPP(Bu ) } , was synthesized .

1105.text: Bulk heterojunction type polymer solar cells based on PDTP - DTDPP(Bu ) and PC 70 BM have broad photocurrent response wavelength range from 300 nm to 1.1 μm .

1107.text: 1 Among photovoltaic polymers , regioregular poly(3 - hexylthiophene ) ( P3HT ) has been extensively studied .

1108.text: Bulk heterojunction ( BHJ ) photovoltaic device combining P3HT as the electron donor with [ 6,6]-phenyl C 61 butyric acid methyl ester ( PCBM ) as the electron acceptor have achieved power conversion efficiencies ( PCEs ) as high as 4 - 5 % .
pred: power conversion efficiencies ( PCEs ) as high as 4 - 5 %

1109.text: 2 However , the upper limit seems to have been reached for this material combination , as P3HT utilizes only photons located in the highenergy fraction of the solar spectrum with wavelengths below 650 nm .

1110.text: 3 Recently , significant progress has been made in the photovoltaic application of novel low - bandgap polymers with optical absorption wavelengths in the range of 700 - 900 nm .

1111.text: The first example of this kind of micrometer - response polymer ( μmR - polymer ) was APFO - Green1 , reported by Ingan € as et al .

1112.text: To date , no more than 10 μmR - polymers have been synthesized , which are primarily based on a very strong electron - deficient unit such as [ 1,2,5]thiadiazolo [ 3,4 - g]quinoxaline , 6 thienopyrazine , 7 or thieno [ 3,4 - c][1,2,5]thiadiazole .

1113.text: 8 The photocurrent response of all of these polymers extends to a wavelength of 1 μm ; however , the external quantum efficiency ( EQE ) of these PSCs in the wavelength range between 650 and 1100 nm is typically less than 10 % , which results in low overall PCEs under AM1.5 simulated solar light .

1114.text: Up to now , the highest PCE of μmR - polymer was just 1.1 % , based on poly(di-2 - thienylthienopyrazine ) by using complicated doubled active layers photovoltaic devices .

1115.text: 7 The fundamental requirements for promising photovoltaic μmR - polymers include the following : ( a ) broad absorption extending to or surpassing 1 μm to absorb more sunlight ; ( b ) a high LUMO energy level to allow effective photoinduced charge transfer from the polymers to the acceptor in the BHJ device and at the same time , a low HOMO level to keep the open circuit voltage ( V OC ) as high as possible ; ( c ) high carrier mobility to ensure that effective charge carrier transport to the electrodes suppresses photocurrent loss ; and ( d ) good solubility and appropriate compatibility with fullerene derivatives to form high - quality films by solution processing .
pred: broad absorption extending to or surpassing 1 μm

1116.text: Very recently , 3,6 - dithien-2 - yl-2 , 5 - dialkylpyrrolo[3,4 - c]pyrrole-1,4 - dione ( DTDPP ) was shown to be a promising building block for the design of photovoltaic polymers .
pred: 3,6 - dithien-2 - yl-2 , 5 - dialkylpyrrolo[3,4 - c]pyrrole-1,4 - dione ( DTDPP )

1117.text: 9 In our previous work , we also found the polymer , PDTP - DTDPP , based on DTDPP and dithieno[3,2 - b : 2 ^ 0 , 3 0 -d]pyrrole was one of potential μmRpolymers .

1119.text: 10 Herein , we present a new donor - acceptor alternative conjugated polymer , changing the alkyl chain in the diketopyrrolopyrrole segment of PDTP - DTDPP from 2 - ethylhexyl to n - butyl .

1121.text: As a result , bulk heterojunction - type polymer solar cells based on PDTP - DTDPP(Bu ) and PC 70 BM have broad photocurrent response wavelength range from 300 nm to 1.1 μm .
pred: broad photocurrent response wavelength range from 300 nm to 1.1 μm .

1124.text: The polymer has good solubility in CHCl 3 but is only partly soluble in chlorobenzene and o - dichlorobenzene .

1125.text: The number - average molecular weight ( M n ) of the polymer is 18.9 kg / mol with a polydispersity index ( PDI ) of 2.04 .

1127.text: The absorption spectrum of PDTP - DTDPP(Bu ) in film is shown in Figure 2 together with that of P3HT and normalized AM 1.5 G photon flux for comparison .

1131.text: All these data indicate that PDTP - DTDPP(Bu ) can utilize a larger fraction of solar light that P3HT as a possible material for applications in micrometer response photovoltaic devices .

1132.text: Electrochemical cyclic voltammetry ( CV ) was performed to determine the highest occupied molecular orbital ( HOMO ) and lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) energy levels of PDTP - DTDPP-(Bu ) .
pred: lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) energy levels

1133.text: The CV curves were recorded referenced to an Ag / Ag þ electrode , which was calibrated against the ferroceneferrocenium ( Fc / Fc þ ) redox couple ( 4.8 eV below the vacuum level ) ; the CV curves are shown in Figure 3 .

1135.text: The XRD patterns of the bulk samples of PDTP - DTDPP(Bu ) and PDTP - DTDPP(EH ) were recorded to understand their structures in the solid state .

1139.text: It has been strongly suggested that high hole mobility is an important requirement for effective photovoltaic polymers .

1140.text: 11 The mobility of PDTP - DTDPP-(Bu ) was measured by using a field - effect transistor ( FET ) with a bottom - gate , top - contact device configuration built on an n - doped silicon wafer .
pred: a field - effect transistor ( FET ) with a bottom - gate , top - contact device configuration

1141.text: Figure 5 shows the typical output and transfer curves of a representative device with PDTP - DTDPP(Bu ) as the channel semiconductor .

1142.text: The hole mobility was estimated to be 0.05 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 , which is 1 - 2 orders of magnitude higher than that of other effective D - A type low - bandgap photovoltaic polymers ( 2.6 x 10 ^ -4 -3 x 10 ^ -3 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 ) .

1143.text: PEDOT : PSS was spin - coated on a precleaned ITO - coated glass substrate .

1144.text: After cooling the substrate , a solution of PDTP - DTDPP(Bu ) and PCBM ( or PC 70 BM ) mixture ( 1 : 2 w / w ) was spin - coated , where a blend of chloroform and o - dichlorobenzene ( 4 : 1 v / v ) was used as the solvent .

1145.text: The devices were completed by evaporating LiF / Al as the cathode .

1146.text: PC 70 BM was also used as an acceptor because it has similar electronic properties as PCBM , but a higher absorption coefficient in the visible region , which can compensate for the poor absorption of PDTP - DTDPP(Bu ) in this range .
pred: but a higher absorption coefficient in the visible region ,

1147.text: The corresponding open - circuit voltage ( V OC ) , short - circuit current ( I SC ) , fill factor ( FF ) , and PCE of the devices are also summarized in Figure 3 .

1148.text: The external quantum efficiency ( EQE ) of the devices under the illumination of monochromatic light is shown in Figure 3 .

1150.text: We compared the experimental I SC under the simulated AM1.5 irradiation and the I SC calculated by integrating the EQE and the actual AM1.5 solar spectra .
pred: I SC calculated by integrating the EQE

1151.text: The calculated I SC from the EQE was 15 % less than the measured I SC .

1152.text: The highest PCE of PSCs based on the PDTP - DTDPP-(Bu ) : PC 70 BM system reached 2.71 % , which was lower than the 4 - 5 % of the P3HT : PCBM devices .

1154.text: In addition , the charge separation efficiency in the current combination might not be as high as that in P3HT : PCBM , although it was difficult to estimate the internal quantum efficiency ( IQE ) accurately due to the light interference effect in the films .

1155.text: This might be attributed to the smaller LUMO offset or less ideal mixing morphology between the polymer and PCBM .

1158.text: Furthermore , comparing the photovoltaic performance of PDTP - DTDPP(Bu ) with PDTP - DTDPP(EH ) suggests that the alkyl chain in the DPP segment has a large influence on the photovoltaic properties of the polymers .

1159.text: 12 Synthesis of new μmR - polymers with different alkyl chain in both the DTDPP segment and the dithieno[3,2 - b : 2 ^ 0 , 3 0 -d]pyrrole segment and a detailed comparison of the properties of all these polymers are now in progress .

1160.text: The energy loss from the low output voltage of the photovoltaic devices ( 0.38 - 0.4 V ) can be attributed to the relatively large difference between the LUMO levels of PDTP - DTDPP(Bu ) and PCBM ( i.e.

1161.text: , small energy difference between the HOMO of PDTP - DTDPP(Bu ) and LUMO of PCBM ) .

1162.text: There is still a room to lower the LUMO level of PDTP - DTDPP(Bu ) from 3.63 to ∼ 4.0 eV , which is ∼ 0.3 eV higher than the LUMO level of PCBM .
pred: LUMO level of PDTP - DTDPP(Bu ) from 3.63

1163.text: If we can control the mixing morphology suitable for the charge separation , this energy offset might be enough to maintain a sufficient driving force for charge transfer and the higher V OC could be expected at the same time .

1164.text: Further fine - tuning of the LUMO and HOMO levels of the polymer by structural modification may improve V OC and promote the utilization of more NIR light by the lower bandgap materials .

1165.text: In conclusion , a highly effective photovoltaic polymer with NIR response , PDTP - DTDPP(Bu ) , based on alternating 3,6 - dithien-2 - yl-2 , 5 - dibutylpyrrolo[3,4 - c]pyrrole-1,4 - dione units has been synthesized .
pred: 3,6 - dithien-2 - yl-2 , 5 - dibutylpyrrolo[3,4 - c]pyrrole-1,4 - dione units
a highly effective photovoltaic polymer with NIR response

1166.text: PDTP - DTDPP(Bu ) has high hole mobility ( 0.05 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 ) and broad photocurrent response wavelengths from 300 nm to 1.1 μm .

1168.text: Considering the sufficiently high I SC values of this system , more promising photovoltaic performance is thought to be achievable by using other fullerene derivatives with high LUMO energy levels , such as bis - PCBM 13 or Lu3N @ C80 - PCBH .
